channel.title: Port Forwarding am I doing it right?
channel.description:
Hello I have been coding rsps' for a long time now and I never really wanted to host any of them, well I finally came to the point where I want to now host, I have gone through multiple tutorials on how to Port Forward and have done what they say.
I have used a Port Tool Check from no-ip and it says that I am hosting a service or I am not blocking that port "43594", but when I try to connect using my client it gets no response from server?
If there is something that I have done wrong please tell me (I have a Bell 2wire router)...
Thanks for reading - James or TehJamDude

item.title: Port Forwarding am I doing it right?
item.dc:creator: @yodudes yodudes
item.description:
@yodudes wrote:

Might sound stupid, but make sure you’re using your external IP. I made the mistake of using my internal IP for years…

Read full topic
item.source: Port Forwarding am I doing it right?

item.title: Port Forwarding am I doing it right?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Thanks:

Make sure ur client ip is the same as ur no-ip(assuming you are using it as u should be) make sure ur host is running on it.

^^WRONG! your ip inside your client needs to set to 127.0.0.1 the no-ip is for others to connect

Read full topic
item.source: Port Forwarding am I doing it right?

@tehjamdude wrote:

Okay Thanks Ill double check that now…
